intro: Gynura dichotoma, commonly known as the silver ragwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, woolly hairs. The plant has opposite, pinnately compound leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Gynura dichotoma is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
